summary: Build a new birthday-surprise website featuring multiple Ghibli-style images of the user and partner, and remove the prior site's photo upload section.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Ghibli-inspired anime watercolor illustration of a couple studying together with a laptop, cozy indoor lighting, warm pastel palette, soft film grain (ghibli-couple-study-laptop.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Ghibli-inspired anime watercolor illustration of a couple sharing biscuits and tea at a small table, warm afternoon light, gentle bokeh, pastel tones (ghibli-couple-biscuits-tea.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Ghibli-inspired anime watercolor illustration of a couple doing gym workouts together, playful energetic mood, soft shaded lighting, pastel colors (ghibli-couple-gym-workout.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Ghibli-inspired anime watercolor illustration of a couple dancing joyfully, flowing motion, sparkling lights, warm celebratory palette (ghibli-couple-dance-joy.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Ghibli-inspired anime watercolor illustration of a couple riding a bicycle together, scenic path, wind-swept hair, lush greenery, warm sunlight (ghibli-couple-bike-together.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Ghibli-inspired anime watercolor illustration symbolizing a heart within the couple, gentle glowing heart motif, dreamy background, warm pastel palette (ghibli-couple-heart-within.dim_1920x1080.png)

existing_features.title: Remove the photo upload option from the existing Photos section so visitors can no longer upload images from their device.

Replace the current preloaded photo list with 6 new static, Ghibli-style couple images (studying on a laptop; biscuits & tea; gym workouts; dancing joyfully; riding a bike together; heart within us) and ensure the slider displays these images.

Add a cohesive, creative "Ghibli storybook birthday surprise" presentation across the Photos section (and its heading) using English user-facing text, while keeping the existing app structure (hero → messages → photos).
Add the 6 newly generated images as static frontend assets and reference them directly from the frontend (do not serve images through the backend).
